---
status: draft
shortDescription: "An expression that reads a variable also updates its value after the evaluation"
shortCorrection: "A variable is only written using an assignment"
concepts:
  - Expression
  - Assignment
  - Variable
related:
  # - id: LiteralNoExpression
  #   relation: Special case
inOtherPl:
  - pl: Scratch
    id: ExpressionAssigns
  # - pl: Python
  #   id: NoAtomicExpression
spec:
  - id: jls21
    sections: ["6.5.6.1", "15.26"]
plVersion:
  # from: ecma6
  # to: ecma11
expressibleInNms:
  - id: StackHeapGlobalDiagram
    how: variable before and after access
  - id: ExpressionAsTree

references:
---

Using a variable in an expression, such as `x+1`,
also updates the value of the variable (`x` in this case)
at the end of the evaluation,
even without an assignment.

frontmatter.shortDescription: An expression that reads a variable also updates its value after the evaluation
frontmatter.shortCorrection: A variable is only written using an assignment
